content.text: Hyderabad : The Telangana High Court dismissed the charges levelled against former MIM Corporator and present Congress leader Khaja Bilal Ahmed by Rachakonda police and ordered his release . After the court orders , Khaja Bilal was released from Cherlapally Central Jail yesterday evening . 4 months ago , Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh M Bhagwat had issued orders invoking the Preventive Detention Act against Khaja Bilal Ahmed . Khaja Bilal Ahmed moved to Telangana High Court against the orders . The matter was heard by Chief Justice TB Radha Krishnan and Justice Raj Shekhar Reddy . According to sources , the high court during the hearing reprimanded the police and asked on what basis PD Act was invoked against Khaja Bilal , does he come under the PD Act ? It must be noted that the former MIM corporator was involved in 15 cases , including rioting and a murder case .
